Mikado.test.assigner_tester module¶

Unit tests for the scales library

class Mikado.test.assigner_tester.AssignerTester(methodName='runTest')[source]¶

Bases: unittest.case.TestCase

This unit test has the purpose of testing the scales module of Mikado.py.

test_J_and_C_case()[source]¶

1 =========————=======———–========————-============= 2 =============———–============

We do expect the comparison to be:

1 reference, 2 prediction: C 1 prediction, 2 reference: J

Returns:
test_J_and_C_case_in_exon()[source]¶

1 =========————=======———–========————-============= 2 =====================———–============

We do expect the comparison to be:

1 reference, 2 prediction: j 1 prediction, 2 reference: J

Notice the class code switch from C to j due to the first exon being internal to the terminal exon, rather than internal to the intron.

Returns:

Mikado.test.test_locus module¶

This module tests the alternative splicing and retained intron functionalities.

class Mikado.test.test_locus.TestLocus(methodName='runTest')[source]¶

Bases: unittest.case.TestCase

This unit test is focussed on the locus definition and alternative splicings.

logger = <logging.Logger object>¶
setUp()[source]¶

Set up for the unit test.

testCreate()[source]¶

Test the creation of the locus :return:

test_addValid()[source]¶

Test that we can successfully add a transcript to the locus if it passes the muster.

test_add_contained()[source]¶

Test that we add a transcript with a contained class code (c) if we explicitly ask for it

test_add_with_retained_intron()[source]¶

Test that a transcript with a retained intron is kept as valid if we change the switch.

test_excludeValid()[source]¶

Test that a usually valid AS is excluded when: - we ask for no more than one AS event - we exclude its ccode (j) - we ask for perfect (100%) CDS overlap

test_exclude_contained()[source]¶

Test that we exclude a transcript with a contained class code (c)

test_exclude_opposite_strand()[source]¶
test_exclude_with_retained_intron()[source]¶

Test that a transcript with a retained intron is chucked out

test_validity()[source]¶

First test of validity to ensure the CCodes are as expected. :return:

Mikado.test.transcript_tester_negative module¶

Unit test for a transcript on the negative strand.

class Mikado.test.transcript_tester_negative.TranscriptTesterNegative(methodName='runTest')[source]¶

Bases: unittest.case.TestCase

l = <Mikado.parsers.GFF.GffLine object>¶
line = 'Chr1 TAIR10 exon 5928 6263 . - . Parent=AT1G01020.1'¶
logger = <logging.Logger object>¶
pos = 22¶
setUp()[source]¶

Basic creation test.

testDoubleOrf()[source]¶

Test to verify the introduction of multiple ORFs.

testSegments()[source]¶
test_basics()[source]¶

Test basic assertions about the transcript:

  • chromosome (.chrom) should be Chr1
  • strand should be -
  • number of internal orfs should be 1
  • number of exons should be 10
  • the metric “exon_num” should be 10 as well
  • start should be 5928 (1-based offset)
  • end should be 8737
  • the exons should correspond to those in the original strings (defined here in the list) and all of them should be of the “Interval” class
Returns:
test_cds()[source]¶
test_empty()[source]¶

Test that a transcript with no exons inside is invalid. :return:

test_introns()[source]¶
test_invalid_utr()[source]¶

Test that a transcript with UTR but no CDS defined will raise an exception. :return:

test_lengths()[source]¶
test_load_orf()[source]¶

Test for loading a single ORF. We strip the CDS and reload it.

test_negative_orf()[source]¶

Test loading a negative strand ORF onto a multiexonic transcript. This should have no effect.

test_print()[source]¶
test_print_no_cds()[source]¶
test_remove_utr()[source]¶

Test for CDS stripping. We remove the UTRs and verify that start/end have moved, no UTR is present, etc.

test_strip_cds()[source]¶

Test the “stip_cds” function which (as the name implies) removes completely the CDS from a transcript. :return:

test_utr()[source]¶
test_utr_metrics()[source]¶

Test for UTR exon num, start distance, etc.

This test verifies the correct ORF loading and splitting

in the case where the transcript has multiple ORFs and in one case it starts exactly at the terminal point of

a previous exon.
